		clicker = player
		converting = true

		spawnZone()
	end

end

function convertButtonCustom1 (object, player)

		clicker = player
		converting = true
		conversionvalue = customcurrencies[1].value
		spawnZone()
	end

end

end

function convertButtonCustom3 (object, player)

		converting = true
		conversionvalue = customcurrencies[3].value
		spawnZone()
	end

end

--[[ Spawn a scripting zone on the input platform. The actual conversion is performed in the callback function calculateAndConvert --]]

function spawnZone()

    --[[spawn scripting zone on in surface--]]

    local p = self.getPosition()
    local r = self.getRotation()
    local s = self.getScale()
	
    params = {}

    params.type = 'ScriptingTrigger'
    	params.callback = 'checkZone'
    params.callback_owner = self
    params.scale = {s.x * 2, 20, s.z}
    params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + 10, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
    params.rotation = self.getRotation()
    
    zone = spawnObject(params)

end

--[[ Check for chips moving in the zone and abort if movement detected --]]
function checkZone()
	startLuaCoroutine(self, 'checkZoneCoroutine')
end

function checkZoneCoroutine()
	local objects = zone.getObjects()
	local positions1 = {}
	local rotations1 = {}
	
	for i, v in ipairs(objects) do
		positions1[#positions1 + 1] = v.getPosition()
		rotations1[#rotations1 + 1] = v.getRotation()
	end
	
	for i=1, 2 do
		coroutine.yield(0)
	end
		
	local objects2 = zone.getObjects()
	local positions2 = {}
	local rotations2 = {}

	--[[ Abort if the amount of chips/stacks changed --]]
	if #objects ~= #objects2 then
		broadcastToColor('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
		zone.destruct()
		converting = false
		return 1
	end
	
	for i, v in ipairs(objects) do
		positions2[#positions2 + 1] = v.getPosition()
		rotations2[#rotations2 + 1] = v.getRotation()
	end
	
	--[[ Abort if any chips/stacks are moving --]]
	for i, v in ipairs (positions1) do
		if v.x ~= positions2[i].x or v.y ~= positions2[i].y or v.z ~= positions2[i].z then
			broadcastToColor ('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
			zone.destruct()
			converting = false
			return 1
		end
		
		if rotations1[i].x ~= rotations2[i].x or rotations1[i].y ~= rotations2[i].y or rotations1[i].z ~= rotations2[i].z then
			broadcastToColor ('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
			zone.destruct()
			converting = false
			return 1
		end
	end
	
	calculateAndConvert()
	return 1
end

--[[ Counts the chips in the zone, spawns new chips, destroys old chips --]]

function calculateAndConvert()

    local chips = {}
    local chipvalues = {1000, 500, 100, 50, 10} -- table with standard chip values
		
	for i, v in ipairs (customcurrencies) do -- adds custom values to chipvalues table
		for j, w in ipairs (chipvalues) do
			if v.value > w then
				table.insert(chipvalues, j, v.value)
				break
			end
		end
	end
    
	local yoffset = 0
    local p = self.getPosition()
    local r = self.getRotation()
    r.z = r.z + 180
    local s = self.getScale()
    local objects = zone.getObjects()

    for i, v in ipairs (objects) do
        if v.tag == 'Chip' and v.getValue() then
            chips[#chips+1] = v
        elseif currencyToNumber(v.getName()) ~= nil then
            if currencyToNumber(v.getName()) > 0 then
                chips[#chips+1] = v
            end
        end
    end

    local value = getChipValues(chips)

    --[[ Abort and print message if the conversion will spawn more chips than the output limit--]]

    if value > (tonumber(conversionvalue) * outputlimit) then
        broadcastToColor('Error: Conversion exceeds output limit of '..outputlimit..' chips. Please reduce input amount, or select a larger conversion value.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
        clicker = {}
		converting = false
        return 0
    end

	--[[ Spawn new chips --]]
	
	for i, v in ipairs (chipvalues) do
        while v <= tonumber(conversionvalue) and v <= value do
			local standardvalues = {["1000"] = true, ["500"] = true, ["100"] = true, ["50"] = true, ["10"] = true}
            local params = {}
			local custom = {}
			
			if standardvalues[tostring(v)] then
				if yoffset == 0 then
					yoffset = 0.0825
				end
				params.type = 'Chip_'..v
				params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + yoffset, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
				params.rotation = r
				spawnObject(params)
				value = value - v
				yoffset = yoffset + 0.165
			else
				local name = ''
				local height = 0
				for j, w in ipairs(customcurrencies) do
					if w.value == v then
						params.rotation = {}
						params.rotation[1] = w.params.rotation[1]
						params.rotation[2] = w.params.rotation[2]
						params.rotation[3] = w.params.rotation[3]
						params.scale = w.params.scale
						custom = w.custom
						name = w.name
						height = w.height
						
						break
					end
				end
				if yoffset == 0 then
					yoffset = height
				end
				
				params.type = 'Custom_Model'
				params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + yoffset, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
				params.rotation[1] = params.rotation[1] + r.x
				params.rotation[2] = params.rotation[2] + r.y
				params.rotation[3] = params.rotation[3] + r.z
				params.callback = 'applyName'
				params.callback_owner = self
				params.params = {name}
				
				local obj = spawnObject(params)
				obj.setCustomObject(custom)
				
				value = value - v
				yoffset = yoffset + height
			end
        end
		
    end

    --[[ destroy zone --]]
    zone.destruct()

    --[[ destroy inserted money --]]
    for i, v in ipairs (chips) do
        v.destruct()
    end

	converting = false
    clicker = {}

end

function applyName(object, pname)
	object.setName(pname[1])
end

function getChipValues(chips)

    local value = 0

    for j, w in ipairs (chips) do
        if w.getQuantity() < 0 then
            if w.getValue() then
                value = value + w.getValue()    
            else
                value = value + currencyToNumber(w.getName())
            end
        else
            if w.getValue() then
                value = value + (w.getValue() * w.getQuantity())
            else
                value = value + (currencyToNumber(w.getName()) * w.getQuantity())
            end
        end
    end

    return value

end

--[[ a crude conversion function to convert a currency to a number. DOES NOT ACCOUNT FOR NEGATIVE NUMBERS. accounts for decimals (for example, $2.50), but will return nil if multiple dots are found, as a valid number would only have one (using american formatting anyway). does not account for other characters, however, so a random string of mixed up numbers and letters will return a value. --]]
function currencyToNumber(s)
	local value = 0 -- the value is updated as numbers are found in the string
	local dec = 1 -- the decimal places (is that the right term?), multiplied by 10 each time a number is found
	local decimalfound = false -- the first time a decimal point is found, used to check for invalid number strings if it finds multiple decimal points (like an ip address)
	local r = string.reverse(s) -- reverse the original string to simplify analysis
	for i = 1, string.len(r) do
		if tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) then -- if the character is a number, add its value times the decimal places to the 'value' variable
			value = value + (tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) * dec)
			dec = dec * 10
		elseif string.sub(r, i, i) == '.' then -- if the character is a decimal point, divide the value by the decimal places and reset the 'dec' variable to 1
			if decimalfound then return nil end
			value = value / dec
			dec = 1
			decimalfound = true
		end
	end
	if value ~= 0 then return value else return nil end -- return the value if it's not still 0, otherwise return nil
end

	--[[ Abort if any chips/stacks are moving --]]
	for i, v in ipairs (positions1) do
		if v.x ~= positions2[i].x or v.y ~= positions2[i].y or v.z ~= positions2[i].z then
			broadcastToColor ('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
			zone.destruct()
			converting = false
			return 1
		end
		
		if rotations1[i].x ~= rotations2[i].x or rotations1[i].y ~= rotations2[i].y or rotations1[i].z ~= rotations2[i].z then
			broadcastToColor ('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
			zone.destruct()
			converting = false
			return 1
		end
	end
	
	calculateAndConvert()
	return 1
end

--[[ Counts the chips in the zone, spawns new chips, destroys old chips --]]

function calculateAndConvert()

    local chips = {}
    local chipvalues = {1000, 500, 100, 50, 10} -- table with standard chip values
		
	for i, v in ipairs (customcurrencies) do -- adds custom values to chipvalues table
		for j, w in ipairs (chipvalues) do
			if v.value > w then
				table.insert(chipvalues, j, v.value)
				break
			end
		end
	end
    
	local yoffset = 0
    local p = self.getPosition()
    local r = self.getRotation()
    r.z = r.z + 180
    local s = self.getScale()
    local objects = zone.getObjects()

    for i, v in ipairs (objects) do
        if v.tag == 'Chip' and v.getValue() then
            chips[#chips+1] = v
        elseif currencyToNumber(v.getName()) ~= nil then
            if currencyToNumber(v.getName()) > 0 then
                chips[#chips+1] = v
            end
        end
    end

    local value = getChipValues(chips)

    --[[ Abort and print message if the conversion will spawn more chips than the output limit--]]

    if value > (tonumber(conversionvalue) * outputlimit) then
        broadcastToColor('Error: Conversion exceeds output limit of '..outputlimit..' chips. Please reduce input amount, or select a larger conversion value.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
        clicker = {}
		converting = false
        return 0
    end

	--[[ Spawn new chips --]]
	
	for i, v in ipairs (chipvalues) do
        while v <= tonumber(conversionvalue) and v <= value do
			local standardvalues = {["1000"] = true, ["500"] = true, ["100"] = true, ["50"] = true, ["10"] = true}
            local params = {}
			local custom = {}
			
			if standardvalues[tostring(v)] then
				if yoffset == 0 then
					yoffset = 0.0825
				end
				params.type = 'Chip_'..v
				params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + yoffset, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
				params.rotation = r
				spawnObject(params)
				value = value - v
				yoffset = yoffset + 0.165
			else
				local name = ''
				local height = 0
				for j, w in ipairs(customcurrencies) do
					if w.value == v then
						params.rotation = {}
						params.rotation[1] = w.params.rotation[1]
						params.rotation[2] = w.params.rotation[2]
						params.rotation[3] = w.params.rotation[3]
						params.scale = w.params.scale
						custom = w.custom
						name = w.name
						height = w.height
						
						break
					end
				end
				if yoffset == 0 then
					yoffset = height
				end
				
				params.type = 'Custom_Model'
				params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + yoffset, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
				params.rotation[1] = params.rotation[1] + r.x
				params.rotation[2] = params.rotation[2] + r.y
				params.rotation[3] = params.rotation[3] + r.z
				params.callback = 'applyName'
				params.callback_owner = self
				params.params = {name}
				
				local obj = spawnObject(params)
				obj.setCustomObject(custom)
				
				value = value - v
				yoffset = yoffset + height
			end
        end
		
    end

    --[[ destroy zone --]]
    zone.destruct()

    --[[ destroy inserted money --]]
    for i, v in ipairs (chips) do
        v.destruct()
    end

	converting = false
    clicker = {}

end

function applyName(object, pname)
	object.setName(pname[1])
end

function getChipValues(chips)

    local value = 0

    for j, w in ipairs (chips) do
        if w.getQuantity() < 0 then
            if w.getValue() then
                value = value + w.getValue()    
            else
                value = value + currencyToNumber(w.getName())
            end
        else
            if w.getValue() then
                value = value + (w.getValue() * w.getQuantity())
            else
                value = value + (currencyToNumber(w.getName()) * w.getQuantity())
            end
        end
    end

    return value

end

--[[ a crude conversion function to convert a currency to a number. DOES NOT ACCOUNT FOR NEGATIVE NUMBERS. accounts for decimals (for example, $2.50), but will return nil if multiple dots are found, as a valid number would only have one (using american formatting anyway). does not account for other characters, however, so a random string of mixed up numbers and letters will return a value. --]]
function currencyToNumber(s)
	local value = 0 -- the value is updated as numbers are found in the string
	local dec = 1 -- the decimal places (is that the right term?), multiplied by 10 each time a number is found
	local decimalfound = false -- the first time a decimal point is found, used to check for invalid number strings if it finds multiple decimal points (like an ip address)
	local r = string.reverse(s) -- reverse the original string to simplify analysis
	for i = 1, string.len(r) do
		if tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) then -- if the character is a number, add its value times the decimal places to the 'value' variable
			value = value + (tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) * dec)
			dec = dec * 10
		elseif string.sub(r, i, i) == '.' then -- if the character is a decimal point, divide the value by the decimal places and reset the 'dec' variable to 1
			if decimalfound then return nil end
			value = value / dec
			dec = 1
			decimalfound = true
		end
	end
	if value ~= 0 then return value else return nil end -- return the value if it's not still 0, otherwise return nil
end

--[[ Spawn a scripting zone on the input platform. The actual conversion is performed in the callback function calculateAndConvert --]]

function spawnZone()

    --[[spawn scripting zone on in surface--]]

    local p = self.getPosition()
    local r = self.getRotation()
    local s = self.getScale()
	
    params = {}

    params.type = 'ScriptingTrigger'
    	params.callback = 'checkZone'
    params.callback_owner = self
    params.scale = {s.x * 2, 20, s.z}
    params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + 10, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
    params.rotation = self.getRotation()
    
    zone = spawnObject(params)

end

--[[ Check for chips moving in the zone and abort if movement detected --]]
function checkZone()
	startLuaCoroutine(self, 'checkZoneCoroutine')
end

function checkZoneCoroutine()
	local objects = zone.getObjects()
	local positions1 = {}
	local rotations1 = {}
	
	for i, v in ipairs(objects) do
		positions1[#positions1 + 1] = v.getPosition()
		rotations1[#rotations1 + 1] = v.getRotation()
	end
	
	for i=1, 2 do
		coroutine.yield(0)
	end
		
	local objects2 = zone.getObjects()
	local positions2 = {}
	local rotations2 = {}

	--[[ Abort if the amount of chips/stacks changed --]]
	if #objects ~= #objects2 then
		broadcastToColor('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})

		converting = false

	end

		end

			broadcastToColor ('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
			zone.destruct()
			converting = false
			return 1
		end
	end
	
	calculateAndConvert()
	return 1
end

					end
				end
				if yoffset == 0 then
					yoffset = height
				end
				
				params.type = 'Custom_Model'
				params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + yoffset, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
				params.rotation[1] = params.rotation[1] + r.x

		["params"] = 
		{

			["scale"] = {0.75, 0.75, 0.75} -- the scale at which to spawn the object

}

    button.position = {-0.75, 0, -0.9}
    button.rotation = {180, 0, 0}
    self.createButton(button)

    button.label = '➧$500'
    button.click_function = 'convertButton500'
    button.position = {-0.45, 0, -0.9}
    self.createButton(button)

    button.label = '➧$1000'
    button.click_function = 'convertButton1000'
    button.position = {-0.15, 0, -0.9}
    self.createButton(button)
	
	for i, v in ipairs (customcurrencies) do
		self.createButton(v.button)
	end
end

--[[ functions for each conversion amount. They simply call spawnZone with the parameters of that amount, and the player who clicked the button --]]

function convertButton100(object, player)

	if not converting then
		clicker = player
		converting = true
		conversionvalue = '100'
		spawnZone()
	end

end

function convertButton500(object, player)

    if not converting then
		clicker = player
		converting = true
		conversionvalue = '500'
		spawnZone()
	end

end

function convertButton1000(object, player)

    if not converting then
		clicker = player
		converting = true
		conversionvalue = '1000'
		spawnZone()
	end

end

function convertButtonCustom1 (object, player)

		clicker = player
		converting = true
		conversionvalue = customcurrencies[1].value
		spawnZone()

end

function convertButtonCustom2 (object, player)

--[[ Spawn a scripting zone on the input platform. The actual conversion is performed in the callback function calculateAndConvert --]]

function spawnZone()

    --[[spawn scripting zone on in surface--]]

    local p = self.getPosition()
    local r = self.getRotation()
    local s = self.getScale()
	
    params = {}

    params.type = 'ScriptingTrigger'
    	params.callback = 'checkZone'
    params.callback_owner = self
    params.scale = {s.x * 2, 20, s.z}
    params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + 10, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
    params.rotation = self.getRotation()
    
    zone = spawnObject(params)

end

--[[ Check for chips moving in the zone and abort if movement detected --]]
function checkZone()
	startLuaCoroutine(self, 'checkZoneCoroutine')
end

function checkZoneCoroutine()
	local objects = zone.getObjects()
	local positions1 = {}
	local rotations1 = {}
	
	for i, v in ipairs(objects) do
		positions1[#positions1 + 1] = v.getPosition()
		rotations1[#rotations1 + 1] = v.getRotation()
	end
	
	for i=1, 2 do
		coroutine.yield(0)
	end
		
	local objects2 = zone.getObjects()
	local positions2 = {}
	local rotations2 = {}

	--[[ Abort if the amount of chips/stacks changed --]]
	if #objects ~= #objects2 then
		broadcastToColor('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
		zone.destruct()
		converting = false
		return 1
	end
	
	for i, v in ipairs(objects) do
		positions2[#positions2 + 1] = v.getPosition()
		rotations2[#rotations2 + 1] = v.getRotation()
	end
	
	--[[ Abort if any chips/stacks are moving --]]
	for i, v in ipairs (positions1) do
		if v.x ~= positions2[i].x or v.y ~= positions2[i].y or v.z ~= positions2[i].z then
			broadcastToColor ('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
			zone.destruct()
			converting = false
			return 1
		end
		
		if rotations1[i].x ~= rotations2[i].x or rotations1[i].y ~= rotations2[i].y or rotations1[i].z ~= rotations2[i].z then
			broadcastToColor ('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
			zone.destruct()
			converting = false
			return 1
		end
	end
	
	calculateAndConvert()
	return 1
end

--[[ Counts the chips in the zone, spawns new chips, destroys old chips --]]

function calculateAndConvert()

    local chips = {}
    local chipvalues = {1000, 500, 100, 50, 10} -- table with standard chip values
		
	for i, v in ipairs (customcurrencies) do -- adds custom values to chipvalues table
		for j, w in ipairs (chipvalues) do
			if v.value > w then
				table.insert(chipvalues, j, v.value)
				break
			end
		end
	end
    
	local yoffset = 0
    local p = self.getPosition()
    local r = self.getRotation()
    r.z = r.z + 180
    local s = self.getScale()
    local objects = zone.getObjects()

    for i, v in ipairs (objects) do
        if v.tag == 'Chip' and v.getValue() then
            chips[#chips+1] = v
        elseif currencyToNumber(v.getName()) ~= nil then
            if currencyToNumber(v.getName()) > 0 then
                chips[#chips+1] = v
            end
        end
    end

    local value = getChipValues(chips)

    --[[ Abort and print message if the conversion will spawn more chips than the output limit--]]

    if value > (tonumber(conversionvalue) * outputlimit) then
        broadcastToColor('Error: Conversion exceeds output limit of '..outputlimit..' chips. Please reduce input amount, or select a larger conversion value.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
        clicker = {}
		converting = false
        return 0
    end

	--[[ Spawn new chips --]]
	
	for i, v in ipairs (chipvalues) do
        while v <= tonumber(conversionvalue) and v <= value do
			local standardvalues = {["1000"] = true, ["500"] = true, ["100"] = true, ["50"] = true, ["10"] = true}
            local params = {}
			local custom = {}
			
			if standardvalues[tostring(v)] then
				if yoffset == 0 then
					yoffset = 0.0825
				end
				params.type = 'Chip_'..v
				params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + yoffset, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
				params.rotation = r
				spawnObject(params)
				value = value - v
				yoffset = yoffset + 0.165
			else
				local name = ''
				local height = 0
				for j, w in ipairs(customcurrencies) do
					if w.value == v then
						params.rotation = {}
						params.rotation[1] = w.params.rotation[1]
						params.rotation[2] = w.params.rotation[2]
						params.rotation[3] = w.params.rotation[3]
						params.scale = w.params.scale
						custom = w.custom
						name = w.name
						height = w.height
						
						break
					end
				end
				if yoffset == 0 then
					yoffset = height
				end
				
				params.type = 'Custom_Model'
				params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + yoffset, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
				params.rotation[1] = params.rotation[1] + r.x
				params.rotation[2] = params.rotation[2] + r.y
				params.rotation[3] = params.rotation[3] + r.z
				params.callback = 'applyName'
				params.callback_owner = self
				params.params = {name}
				
				local obj = spawnObject(params)
				obj.setCustomObject(custom)
				
				value = value - v
				yoffset = yoffset + height
			end
        end
		
    end

    --[[ destroy zone --]]
    zone.destruct()

    --[[ destroy inserted money --]]
    for i, v in ipairs (chips) do
        v.destruct()
    end

	converting = false
    clicker = {}

end

function applyName(object, pname)
	object.setName(pname[1])
end

function getChipValues(chips)

    local value = 0

    for j, w in ipairs (chips) do
        if w.getQuantity() < 0 then
            if w.getValue() then
                value = value + w.getValue()    
            else
                value = value + currencyToNumber(w.getName())
            end
        else
            if w.getValue() then
                value = value + (w.getValue() * w.getQuantity())
            else
                value = value + (currencyToNumber(w.getName()) * w.getQuantity())
            end
        end
    end

    return value

end

--[[ a crude conversion function to convert a currency to a number. DOES NOT ACCOUNT FOR NEGATIVE NUMBERS. accounts for decimals (for example, $2.50), but will return nil if multiple dots are found, as a valid number would only have one (using american formatting anyway). does not account for other characters, however, so a random string of mixed up numbers and letters will return a value. --]]
function currencyToNumber(s)
	local value = 0 -- the value is updated as numbers are found in the string
	local dec = 1 -- the decimal places (is that the right term?), multiplied by 10 each time a number is found
	local decimalfound = false -- the first time a decimal point is found, used to check for invalid number strings if it finds multiple decimal points (like an ip address)
	local r = string.reverse(s) -- reverse the original string to simplify analysis
	for i = 1, string.len(r) do
		if tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) then -- if the character is a number, add its value times the decimal places to the 'value' variable
			value = value + (tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) * dec)
			dec = dec * 10
		elseif string.sub(r, i, i) == '.' then -- if the character is a decimal point, divide the value by the decimal places and reset the 'dec' variable to 1
			if decimalfound then return nil end
			value = value / dec
			dec = 1
			decimalfound = true
		end
	end
	if value ~= 0 then return value else return nil end -- return the value if it's not still 0, otherwise return nil
end

DOES NOT ACCOUNT FOR NEGATIVE NUMBERS. accounts for decimals (for example, $2.50), but will return nil if multiple dots are found, as a valid number would only have one (using american formatting anyway). does not account for other characters, however, so a random string of mixed up numbers and letters will return a value. --]]
function currencyToNumber(s)
	local value = 0 -- the value is updated as numbers are found in the string
	local dec = 1 -- the decimal places (is that the right term?), multiplied by 10 each time a number is found
	local decimalfound = false -- the first time a decimal point is found, used to check for invalid number strings if it finds multiple decimal points (like an ip address)
	local r = string.reverse(s) -- reverse the original string to simplify analysis
	for i = 1, string.len(r) do
		if tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) then -- if the character is a number, add its value times the decimal places to the 'value' variable
			value = value + (tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) * dec)
			dec = dec * 10
		elseif string.sub(r, i, i) == '.' then -- if the character is a decimal point, divide the value by the decimal places and reset the 'dec' variable to 1
			if decimalfound then return nil end
			value = value / dec
			dec = 1
			decimalfound = true
		end
	end
	if value ~= 0 then return value else return nil end -- return the value if it's not still 0, otherwise return nil
end

function convertButton100(object, player)

		clicker = player
		converting = true
		conversionvalue = '100'

	end

end

		clicker = player
		converting = true

end

		clicker = player

end

function convertButtonCustom1 (object, player)

		clicker = player

--[[ Spawn a scripting zone on the input platform. The actual conversion is performed in the callback function calculateAndConvert --]]

function spawnZone()

    --[[spawn scripting zone on in surface--]]

    local p = self.getPosition()
    local r = self.getRotation()
    local s = self.getScale()
	
    params = {}

    params.type = 'ScriptingTrigger'
    	params.callback = 'checkZone'
    params.callback_owner = self
    params.scale = {s.x * 2, 20, s.z}
    params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + 10, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
    params.rotation = self.getRotation()
    
    zone = spawnObject(params)

end

--[[ Check for chips moving in the zone and abort if movement detected --]]
function checkZone()
	startLuaCoroutine(self, 'checkZoneCoroutine')
end

function checkZoneCoroutine()
	local objects = zone.getObjects()
	local positions1 = {}
	local rotations1 = {}
	
	for i, v in ipairs(objects) do
		positions1[#positions1 + 1] = v.getPosition()
		rotations1[#rotations1 + 1] = v.getRotation()
	end
	
	for i=1, 2 do
		coroutine.yield(0)
	end
		
	local objects2 = zone.getObjects()
	local positions2 = {}
	local rotations2 = {}

	--[[ Abort if the amount of chips/stacks changed --]]
	if #objects ~= #objects2 then
		broadcastToColor('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
		zone.destruct()
		converting = false
		return 1
	end
	
	for i, v in ipairs(objects) do
		positions2[#positions2 + 1] = v.getPosition()
		rotations2[#rotations2 + 1] = v.getRotation()
	end
	
	--[[ Abort if any chips/stacks are moving --]]
	for i, v in ipairs (positions1) do
		if v.x ~= positions2[i].x or v.y ~= positions2[i].y or v.z ~= positions2[i].z then
			broadcastToColor ('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
			zone.destruct()
			converting = false
			return 1
		end
		
		if rotations1[i].x ~= rotations2[i].x or rotations1[i].y ~= rotations2[i].y or rotations1[i].z ~= rotations2[i].z then
			broadcastToColor ('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
			zone.destruct()
			converting = false
			return 1
		end
	end
	
	calculateAndConvert()
	return 1
end

--[[ Counts the chips in the zone, spawns new chips, destroys old chips --]]

function calculateAndConvert()

    local chips = {}
    local chipvalues = {1000, 500, 100, 50, 10} -- table with standard chip values
		
	for i, v in ipairs (customcurrencies) do -- adds custom values to chipvalues table
		for j, w in ipairs (chipvalues) do
			if v.value > w then
				table.insert(chipvalues, j, v.value)
				break
			end
		end
	end
    
	local yoffset = 0
    local p = self.getPosition()
    local r = self.getRotation()
    r.z = r.z + 180
    local s = self.getScale()
    local objects = zone.getObjects()

    for i, v in ipairs (objects) do
        if v.tag == 'Chip' and v.getValue() then
            chips[#chips+1] = v
        elseif currencyToNumber(v.getName()) ~= nil then
            if currencyToNumber(v.getName()) > 0 then
                chips[#chips+1] = v
            end
        end
    end

    local value = getChipValues(chips)

    --[[ Abort and print message if the conversion will spawn more chips than the output limit--]]

    if value > (tonumber(conversionvalue) * outputlimit) then
        broadcastToColor('Error: Conversion exceeds output limit of '..outputlimit..' chips. Please reduce input amount, or select a larger conversion value.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
        clicker = {}
		converting = false
        return 0
    end

	--[[ Spawn new chips --]]
	
	for i, v in ipairs (chipvalues) do
        while v <= tonumber(conversionvalue) and v <= value do
			local standardvalues = {["1000"] = true, ["500"] = true, ["100"] = true, ["50"] = true, ["10"] = true}
            local params = {}
			local custom = {}
			
			if standardvalues[tostring(v)] then
				if yoffset == 0 then
					yoffset = 0.0825
				end
				params.type = 'Chip_'..v
				params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + yoffset, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
				params.rotation = r
				spawnObject(params)
				value = value - v
				yoffset = yoffset + 0.165
			else
				local name = ''
				local height = 0
				for j, w in ipairs(customcurrencies) do
					if w.value == v then
						params.rotation = {}
						params.rotation[1] = w.params.rotation[1]
						params.rotation[2] = w.params.rotation[2]
						params.rotation[3] = w.params.rotation[3]
						params.scale = w.params.scale
						custom = w.custom
						name = w.name
						height = w.height
						
						break
					end
				end
				if yoffset == 0 then
					yoffset = height
				end
				
				params.type = 'Custom_Model'
				params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + yoffset, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
				params.rotation[1] = params.rotation[1] + r.x
				params.rotation[2] = params.rotation[2] + r.y
				params.rotation[3] = params.rotation[3] + r.z
				params.callback = 'applyName'
				params.callback_owner = self
				params.params = {name}
				
				local obj = spawnObject(params)
				obj.setCustomObject(custom)
				
				value = value - v
				yoffset = yoffset + height
			end
        end
		
    end

    --[[ destroy zone --]]
    zone.destruct()

    --[[ destroy inserted money --]]
    for i, v in ipairs (chips) do
        v.destruct()
    end

	converting = false
    clicker = {}

end

function applyName(object, pname)
	object.setName(pname[1])
end

function getChipValues(chips)

    local value = 0

    for j, w in ipairs (chips) do
        if w.getQuantity() < 0 then
            if w.getValue() then
                value = value + w.getValue()    
            else
                value = value + currencyToNumber(w.getName())
            end
        else
            if w.getValue() then
                value = value + (w.getValue() * w.getQuantity())
            else
                value = value + (currencyToNumber(w.getName()) * w.getQuantity())
            end
        end
    end

    return value

end

--[[ a crude conversion function to convert a currency to a number. DOES NOT ACCOUNT FOR NEGATIVE NUMBERS. accounts for decimals (for example, $2.50), but will return nil if multiple dots are found, as a valid number would only have one (using american formatting anyway). does not account for other characters, however, so a random string of mixed up numbers and letters will return a value. --]]
function currencyToNumber(s)
	local value = 0 -- the value is updated as numbers are found in the string
	local dec = 1 -- the decimal places (is that the right term?), multiplied by 10 each time a number is found
	local decimalfound = false -- the first time a decimal point is found, used to check for invalid number strings if it finds multiple decimal points (like an ip address)
	local r = string.reverse(s) -- reverse the original string to simplify analysis
	for i = 1, string.len(r) do
		if tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) then -- if the character is a number, add its value times the decimal places to the 'value' variable
			value = value + (tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) * dec)
			dec = dec * 10
		elseif string.sub(r, i, i) == '.' then -- if the character is a decimal point, divide the value by the decimal places and reset the 'dec' variable to 1
			if decimalfound then return nil end
			value = value / dec
			dec = 1
			decimalfound = true
		end
	end
	if value ~= 0 then return value else return nil end -- return the value if it's not still 0, otherwise return nil
end

			return 1
		end
		
		if rotations1[i].x ~= rotations2[i].x or rotations1[i].y ~= rotations2[i].y or rotations1[i].z ~= rotations2[i].z then
			broadcastToColor ('Conversion aborted. Please wait for chips to be at rest on the platform and try again.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
			zone.destruct()
			converting = false
			return 1
		end
	end
	
	calculateAndConvert()
	return 1
end

--[[ Counts the chips in the zone, spawns new chips, destroys old chips --]]

function calculateAndConvert()

    local chips = {}
    local chipvalues = {1000, 500, 100, 50, 10} -- table with standard chip values
		
	for i, v in ipairs (customcurrencies) do -- adds custom values to chipvalues table
		for j, w in ipairs (chipvalues) do
			if v.value > w then
				table.insert(chipvalues, j, v.value)
				break
			end
		end
	end
    
	local yoffset = 0
    local p = self.getPosition()
    local r = self.getRotation()
    r.z = r.z + 180
    local s = self.getScale()
    local objects = zone.getObjects()

    for i, v in ipairs (objects) do
        if v.tag == 'Chip' and v.getValue() then
            chips[#chips+1] = v
        elseif currencyToNumber(v.getName()) ~= nil then
            if currencyToNumber(v.getName()) > 0 then
                chips[#chips+1] = v
            end
        end
    end

    local value = getChipValues(chips)

    --[[ Abort and print message if the conversion will spawn more chips than the output limit--]]

    if value > (tonumber(conversionvalue) * outputlimit) then
        broadcastToColor('Error: Conversion exceeds output limit of '..outputlimit..' chips. Please reduce input amount, or select a larger conversion value.', clicker, {1, 0, 0})
        clicker = {}
		converting = false
        return 0
    end

	--[[ Spawn new chips --]]
	
	for i, v in ipairs (chipvalues) do
        while v <= tonumber(conversionvalue) and v <= value do
			local standardvalues = {["1000"] = true, ["500"] = true, ["100"] = true, ["50"] = true, ["10"] = true}
            local params = {}
			local custom = {}
			
			if standardvalues[tostring(v)] then
				if yoffset == 0 then
					yoffset = 0.0825
				end
				params.type = 'Chip_'..v
				params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + yoffset, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
				params.rotation = r
				spawnObject(params)
				value = value - v
				yoffset = yoffset + 0.165
			else
				local name = ''
				local height = 0
				for j, w in ipairs(customcurrencies) do
					if w.value == v then
						params.rotation = {}
						params.rotation[1] = w.params.rotation[1]
						params.rotation[2] = w.params.rotation[2]
						params.rotation[3] = w.params.rotation[3]
						params.scale = w.params.scale
						custom = w.custom
						name = w.name
						height = w.height
						
						break
					end
				end
				if yoffset == 0 then
					yoffset = height
				end
				
				params.type = 'Custom_Model'
				params.position = {p.x - ((s.z/2) * math.sin(math.rad(r.y))), p.y + yoffset, p.z - ((s.z/2) * math.cos(math.rad(r.y)))}
				params.rotation[1] = params.rotation[1] + r.x
				params.rotation[2] = params.rotation[2] + r.y
				params.rotation[3] = params.rotation[3] + r.z
				params.callback = 'applyName'
				params.callback_owner = self
				params.params = {name}
				
				local obj = spawnObject(params)
				obj.setCustomObject(custom)
				
				value = value - v
				yoffset = yoffset + height
			end
        end
		
    end

    --[[ destroy zone --]]
    zone.destruct()

    --[[ destroy inserted money --]]
    for i, v in ipairs (chips) do
        v.destruct()
    end

	converting = false
    clicker = {}

end

function applyName(object, pname)
	object.setName(pname[1])
end

function getChipValues(chips)

    local value = 0

    for j, w in ipairs (chips) do
        if w.getQuantity() < 0 then
            if w.getValue() then
                value = value + w.getValue()    
            else
                value = value + currencyToNumber(w.getName())
            end
        else
            if w.getValue() then
                value = value + (w.getValue() * w.getQuantity())
            else
                value = value + (currencyToNumber(w.getName()) * w.getQuantity())
            end
        end
    end

    return value

end

--[[ a crude conversion function to convert a currency to a number. DOES NOT ACCOUNT FOR NEGATIVE NUMBERS. accounts for decimals (for example, $2.50), but will return nil if multiple dots are found, as a valid number would only have one (using american formatting anyway). does not account for other characters, however, so a random string of mixed up numbers and letters will return a value. --]]
function currencyToNumber(s)
	local value = 0 -- the value is updated as numbers are found in the string
	local dec = 1 -- the decimal places (is that the right term?), multiplied by 10 each time a number is found
	local decimalfound = false -- the first time a decimal point is found, used to check for invalid number strings if it finds multiple decimal points (like an ip address)
	local r = string.reverse(s) -- reverse the original string to simplify analysis
	for i = 1, string.len(r) do
		if tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) then -- if the character is a number, add its value times the decimal places to the 'value' variable
			value = value + (tonumber(string.sub(r, i, i)) * dec)
			dec = dec * 10
		elseif string.sub(r, i, i) == '.' then -- if the character is a decimal point, divide the value by the decimal places and reset the 'dec' variable to 1
			if decimalfound then return nil end
			value = value / dec
			dec = 1
			decimalfound = true
		end
	end
	if value ~= 0 then return value else return nil end -- return the value if it's not still 0, otherwise return nil
end

ObjectStates.LuaScript:
function onload()

    local button = {}
    button.label = 'Muck Hand'
    button.font_size = 175
    button.width = 1000
    button.height = 300
    button.position = {0, 0, 2}
    button.rotation = {0, 0, 0}
    button.click_function = 'muckHand'
    button.function_owner = self
    self.createButton(button)

    button.position = {0, 0, -2}
    button.rotation = {0, 180, 0}
    self.createButton(button)

end

function muckHand (object, player)

    local cards = Player[player].getHandObjects()
    local p = self.getPosition()
    local r = self.getRotation()
    p.y = p.y + 0.25
    r.x = 180
    r.z = 0

    for i, v in ipairs (cards) do
        v.setRotation(r)
        v.setPosition(p)
        v.translate({0, 0.1, 0})
        p.y = p.y + 0.01
    end

    --[[ move action to next player if action on clicker --]]
    local a = Global.getVar('actionon')

    if player == a then
        startLuaCoroutine(self, 'delayedAction')
    end
 
end

function delayedAction()
    for i = 1, 2 do
        coroutine.yield(0)
    end
    Global.call('action')
    return 1
end

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Model_Infinite_Bag
ObjectStates.Description: Place desired quantity in the bet zone of a busted player to force that player to sit out. One bomb will be deleted each time a new hand is dealt.

ObjectStates.Name: Custom_Model
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
oldpos = {}
oldrot = {}
boardzone = {}
boardzoneGUID = '5a1d5c'
s = {}

function onload()
    boardzone = getObjectFromGUID(boardzoneGUID)
    s = boardzone.getScale()
    oldpos = self.getPosition()
    oldrot = self.getRotation()
end

function update()
    local pos = self.getPosition()
    local rot = self.getRotation()

    if pos ~= oldpos or rot ~= oldrot then
        boardzone.setPosition(pos)
        boardzone.setRotation(rot)
        oldpos = pos
        oldrot = rot
    end
    boardzone.setScale({s.x*self.getScale().x, s.y*self.getScale().y, s.z*self.getScale().z})

end

--[[ dropped flag set to true the first time the object gets dropped.
    this is required because onPickedUp will fire when it's pulled out of the infinite bag. --]]
dropped = false 

function onDropped(player_color)
    dropped = true
end

function onPickedUp(player_color)
    if dropped then
        if self.getName() == '' then
            self.setName(Player[player_color].steam_name) -- name the object after the player who picks it up
            self.setDescription(Player[player_color].steam_id) -- set the description to the player's steam ID
        end
        self.setLuaScript('') -- delete the script
    end
end

ObjectStates.Name: Bag
ObjectStates.LuaScript:
--[[ Multiple objects infinite bag script by Skor --]]

--[[ Customizable variables --]]
distance = 2 -- the distance between the layers of objects
objectsperlayer = 6 -- how many objects in first layer around the baseobject 
--[[ End of customizable variables --]]

objects = {} -- A table of the objects pulled from the container
baseobject = nil -- The first object pulled out, which is what the other ones will follow

function onObjectLeaveContainer(container, object)
    if container ~= self then return 1 end
	if baseobject ~= nil and baseobject ~= null then return 1 end
	
	self.interactable = false  -- Make the container non-interactable to prevent other players from removing objects while a player is holding the objects from the container. Note that objects can still be put into the container even while non-interactive.
    baseobject = object
    startLuaCoroutine(self, 'objectTaken')
end

--[[ This coroutine is necessary because the object pulled from the container is not immediately registered as being held by a player --]]
function objectTaken()
	
    coroutine.yield(0)
	
	--[[ Abort function if object not held by player (for example, dropping an object out with alt + rightclick, or pulling from the search function) --]]
    if not baseobject.held_by_color then 
		self.interactable = true
		baseobject = nil
		objects = {}
		return 1 
	end

    objects = {baseobject}
	local p = baseobject.getPosition()
	local r = baseobject.getRotation()
	
	--[[ Take out remaining objects and add them to the table --]]
    for i, v in ipairs (self.getObjects()) do
        objects[#objects+1] = self.takeObject({['position'] = baseobject.getPosition(), ['rotation'] = baseobject.getRotation()})
    end

    for i, v in ipairs (objects) do
		--[[ Clone the objects and place into the bag --]]
        self.putObject(v.clone({['position'] = {self.getPosition().x, self.getPosition().y + 2, self.getPosition().z}}))
		
		--[[ The objects not held by the player are picking up falling speed from gravity, even though they are kept in the same position by the script. Gravity is turned off here and restored later to prevent them from slamming into the table when dropped. --]]
		v.use_gravity = false
    end

    startLuaCoroutine(self, 'updateObjects')

    return 1
end

--[[ Update positions of objects as long as the baseobject is held by a player --]]
function updateObjects()
    while baseobject.held_by_color and baseobject ~= null do
		local p = baseobject.getPosition()
		local r = baseobject.getRotation()
		local layercounter = 0
		local layer = 1
        for i, v in ipairs(objects) do
            if i > 1 and v ~= null then
                v.setPosition({p.x + (math.cos(math.rad(r.y + ((360/(objectsperlayer * layer)) * i))) * (layer * distance)), p.y, p.z - (math.sin(math.rad(r.y + ((360/(objectsperlayer * layer)) * i))) * (layer * distance))})
				v.setRotation(r)
				layercounter = layercounter + 1
            end

			if layercounter >= (objectsperlayer * layer) then
				layer = layer + 1
				layercounter = 0
			end
        end
				
        coroutine.yield(0)
    end
	
	--[[ Restore gravity to objects --]]
	for i, v in ipairs (objects) do 
		v.use_gravity = true
	end

	--[[ Wait and reset variables and make interactable again --]]
	
	for i = 1, 60 do coroutine.yield(0) end
	
	self.interactable = true
    baseobject = nil
    objects = {}
    return 1
end

--[[ If baseobject is destroyed, make interactable and restore gravity to other objects --]]
function onObjectDestroyed(o)
	if o == baseobject then
		for i, v in ipairs (objects) do
			if v~= null then
				v.use_gravity = true
			end
		end
		self.interactable = true
		objects = {}
	end
end
